revised_title: Electromagnetic Induction in a Rotating Sphere: Applications to Terrestrial Magnetism
tldr: The author investigates the induction of electric currents in a rotating conducting sphere surrounded by a stationary conducting shell. The focus is on the toroidal magnetic fields generated, which are confined to the interior of the conductor and may play a significant role in terrestrial magnetism. The study provides expressions for the toroidal field and the mechanical couple produced by induction with a field parallel to the axis of rotation.
